All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractDAO<T>
AbstractDAO is a generic Data Access Object (DAO) that provides basic CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations using reflection and generics to map Java objects to database tables.
AddClientView
The AddClientView class represents a GUI view for adding a new client.
AddNewProduct
The AddNewProduct class represents a GUI view for adding a new product.
Bill
The Bill record represents a bill entity with attributes such as bill
BillBLL
Business Logic Layer class responsible for handling operations related to bills.
BillDAO
This class provides data access operations for the Bill table in the database.
ChooseQuantity
The ChooseQuantity class represents a GUI view for selecting a quantity.
ClientAgeValidator
Validator class to validate the age of a client.
ClientBLL
Business Logic Layer class responsible for handling operations related to clients.
ClientDAO
This class provides data access operations for the Clients table in the database.
ClientOptionsView
The ClientOptionsView class represents a GUI view with options for managing clients.
Clients
The Clients class represents a client entity with attributes such as ID, name, address, email, and age.
ConnectionFactory
Connection class for the database
Controller
Controller class manages user interactions and coordinates actions between the view and the business logic layers.
EmailValidator
Class purpose is to validate the email address
EnterId
View class for selecting an ID from a JComboBox.
ErrorView
The ErrorView class provides a method to display error messages in a dialog box.
OptionView
The OptionView class represents a GUI view with options for clients, product operations, and order creation.
OrderBLL
Business Logic Layer class responsible for handling operations related to orders.
OrderDAO
The OrderDAO class provides data access methods for interacting with the Orders table in the database.
Orders
The Orders class represents an order made by a client for a specific product.
ProductAmountValidator
Validator class to validate the amount of products available.
ProductBLL
Business Logic Layer class responsible for handling operations related to products.
ProductDAO
The ProductDAO class provides data access methods for interacting with the Products table in the database.

Products
The Products class represents a product with its details.

Utility class for performing reflection operations on objects.

The Start class initializes and launches the application.
